{{Infobox soap character 2 |series=Emmerdale |name=Jai Sharma |introducer=[[Gavin Blyth]] |portrayer=[[Chris Bisson]] |years=2009â |classification=[[List of Emmerdale characters#Present characters|Present; regular]] |home=Holdgate Farm |occupation= [[Businessperson|Businessman]] |first=11 September 2009 |father = [[Rishi Sharma]] |mother = [[Georgia Sharma]] |brothers=[[Nikhil Sharma]] |sisters=[[Priya Sharma]] |daughters=[[Mia Macey]] }} '''Jai Sharma''' is a [[fictional character]] from the British [[ITV1]] [[soap opera]] ''[[Emmerdale]]'', played by [[Chris Bisson]]. He made his first on-screen appearance on 11 September 2009.
==Character creation and casting== On 21 July 2009, entertainment website ''[[Digital Spy]]'' reported that ''Emmerdale'' would be introducing "a new trio of entrepreneurial siblings", Jai, Nikhil and Priya Sharma as part of the soap's ongoing reinvention.<ref name="three">{{cite news|url= http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s12/emmerdale/news/a166312/three-more-added-to-emmerdale-cast.html|title=Three more added to 'Emmerdale' cast|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|author=Kilkelly, Daniel|date=21 July 2009|accessdate=21 January 2011}}</ref> Former ''[[Coronation Street]]'' actor [[Chris Bisson]] was cast as Jai Sharma, along with [[Rik Makarem]] and Effie Woods who were cast in the roles of [[Nikhil Sharma|Nikhil]] and [[Priya Sharma]] respectively. Of his casting Bisson commented: "Jai is a bit of a charmer and has an eye for the ladies but he's also a hard worker with a good business mind. I'm delighted to be joining Emmerdale at a time when the show is going from strength to strength. I can't wait to get started."<ref name="three"/> The show's series producer Gavin Blyth said of the family: "The Sharmas are a young, contemporary family independent of their parents and will bring the factory into the heart of the village community. They will add real vitality to life in ''Emmerdale''."<ref name="three"/> Bisson began filming his scenes on 21 July.<ref name="three"/>
==Character Development== On July 21, 2009, it was announced that three new cast members had been added to make up the new Sharma family.<ref>http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s12/emmerdale/news/a166312/three-more-added-to-emmerdale-cast.html</ref> Bisson said of his new role, "Jai is a bit of a charmer and has an eye for the ladies but he's also a hard worker with a good business mind." Emmerdale producer Gavin Blyth described the family as "a young, contemporary family independent of their parents and will bring the factory into the heart of the village community." In an interview on September 1, 2009, Bisson explained the Sharma backstory, that "Jai had left the family business and set up a chain of mobile phone shops, sold them at the top of the market, and now has a load of money... Jai will take chances, he's a bit of a maverick, he can talk people round, he can get the best out of people and that's irritating for Nikhil because he's not at all like his big brother." <ref>http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/a174467/chris-bisson-on-the-sharmas-charity-and-west-is-west.html</ref>
==Reception== Holy Soap describe Jai's most memorable moment as: "Informing brother Nikhil that he now owned the factory, rather than their father."<ref name="jai holysoap">{{cite web|title=Holy Soap > Emmerdale > Cast > Jai Sharma|url=http://holysoap.five.tv/emmerdale/cast/jai-sharma-8715|work=[[Channel Five]]|publisher=([[RTL Group]])|accessdate=21 January 2011}}</ref>
